headline: Nvidia Shares Surge on Big Tech’s $650 Billion AI-Spending Plan
summary: Shares of the chipmaker rose as much as 7.7%, the biggest intraday jump since April 9, adding more than $300 billion in market value.  Amazon.com Inc. sparked the rebound after the technology giant said during an earnings call that it plans to spend $200 billion on data centers, chips and other equipment this year.  All told, Amazon, along with Alphabet Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Microsoft Corp., are expected to shell out roughly $650 billion for AI tools in 2026, about 60% more than the prior year.

headline: 2 Large-Cap Stocks Worth Your Attention and 1 Facing Challenges
summary: Large-cap stocks usually command their industries because they have the scale to drive market trends. The flip side though is that their sheer size can limit growth as expanding further becomes an increasingly challenging task.

headline: Is Western Digital (WDC) Still Reasonably Priced After Its Powerful Multi‑Year Share Price Surge
summary: If you are wondering whether Western Digital's share price still reflects reasonable value after its strong run, this article will walk through what that price might be saying. The stock last closed at US$260.19, with returns of 4.0% over 7 days, 30.2% over 30 days, 38.6% year to date, and about 7x over 3 years. Recent attention on Western Digital has been shaped by sector wide interest in data storage and memory related plays, as investors look more closely at companies exposed to these...
